    • setUp

    • testRemoveObject

      public void testRemoveObject()

      Summary

      Test StackAdapter.remove method

      Test Case Design

      This test verifies the proper functioning of the remove(Object) method of the StackAdapter.

      Test Description

      This test verifies that the remove method removes the first occurrence in this StackAdapter of the specified element. If this StackAdapter does not contain the element, it is unchanged. More formally, removes the element with the lowest index i such that (o==null ? get(i)==null : o.equals(get(i))) (if such an element exists).

      Pre-Condition

      emptyStack needs to be empty. oneStack contains only one element. longStack contains 100 elements.

      Post-Condition

      The StackAdapter decreases its size by one after the call to remove() method. No exception is thrown.

      Expected Result

      Regardless its previous size, the StackAdapter has decreased its size due to the remove() method, no exception is thrown.

    • testRemoveIndex

      public void testRemoveIndex()

      Summary

      Test StackAdapter.remove method

      Test Case Design

      This test verifies the proper functioning of the remove(int) method of the StackAdapter.

      Test Description

      This test verifies that the add method removes the element at the specified position in this list. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices). Returns the element that was removed from the list.

      Pre-Condition

      emptyStack needs to be empty. oneStack contains only one element. longStack contains 100 elements.

      Post-Condition

      The StackAdapter decreases its size by one after the call to remove() method. No exception is thrown.

      Expected Result

      Regardless its previous size, the StackAdapter has decreased its size due to the remove() method, no exception is thrown.

    • testRemoveIndexOutOfBoundsException1

      public void testRemoveIndexOutOfBoundsException1()

      Summary

      Test StackAdapter.remove method

      Test Case Design

      This test verifies the proper functioning of the remove(int) method of the StackAdapter.

      Test Description

      This test verifies that the add method removes the element at the specified position in this list. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices). Returns the element that was removed from the list. In particular if the index is out of range (index < 0).

      Pre-Condition

      emptyStack needs to be empty. oneStack contains only one element. longStack contains 100 elements.

      Post-Condition

      The call to remove() method fails and the StackAdapter hasn't changed its size. IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

      Expected Result

      The call to remove() method fails and the StackAdapter hasn't changed its size. IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

    • testRemoveIndexOutOfBoundsException2

      public void testRemoveIndexOutOfBoundsException2()

      Summary

      Test StackAdapter.remove method

      Test Case Design

      This test verifies the proper functioning of the remove(int) method of the StackAdapter.

      Test Description

      This test verifies that the add method removes the element at the specified position in this list. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices). Returns the element that was removed from the list. In particular if the index is out of range (index >= size()).

      Pre-Condition

      emptyStack needs to be empty. oneStack contains only one element. longStack contains 100 elements.

      Post-Condition

      The call to remove() method fails and the StackAdapter hasn't changed its size. IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

      Expected Result

      The call to remove() method fails and the StackAdapter hasn't changed its size. IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.
